#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Progressive Conservative candidate John O'Toole , Durham
#Text=Tuesday , October 9 , 2007
#Text=John O'Toole is running for the Progressive Conservative in the Ontario provincial election , in the Durham riding .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I originally become involved in politics when members of the community suggested I stand for election as a local school trustee .
#Text=As a parent , I was naturally interested in school board issues .
#Text=This later led to my involvement as an elected municipal councillor for Clarington .
#Text=One of my responsibilities on Council was as Chair of the local budget process .
#Text=I was first elected to the Ontario Legislature in 1995 .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I have experience at both the local and provincial level .

#Text=In addition , my 30 years with General Motors has given me a strong background in the business sector , especially within the auto industry and related manufacturing enterprises that are so important to Durham Riding .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ?
#Text=Why ?
#Text=In my most recent campaigns , the Liberal Party candidate has placed second and the New Democratic Party candidate third .
#Text=However , when I first ran for office in 1995 , the incumbent MPP was a New Democrat .
#Text=I try to learn from previous campaigns , but take nothing for granted and try to treat each campaign like it ’s a new beginning – a new opportunity to win the support of local citizens .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=I have direct experience in the Ontario Legislature for three terms , and have a solid background in ensuring constituents get the help they need when dealing with provincial issues .
#Text=Given the fact that I have over 25 years of elected experience , I also have the advantage of many contacts within community organizations and local government .
#Text=In other words , I understand the community and work hard to ensure Durham Riding has the best possible representation at Queen ’s Park .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
